article.headline: Illinois St. 65, Indiana St. 62
article.story: NORMAL, Ill. (AP) -- Dinma Odiakosa and Osiris Eldridge both scored 15 points as Illinois State edged past Indiana State 65-62 on Sunday afternoon. The Redbirds (15-5, 7-2 Missouri Valley) took a slim 33-28 lead into halftime in a game that was tied four times and in which the lead also changed four times. The Sycamores (10-9, 5-4 MVC) looked like they might fall by the wayside at several points in the game, but they continued to storm back and keep it close. With two minutes left, Indiana State tied it up 59-59 on a 3-pointer by Marico Stinson, who scored a game-high 22 points on 4-of-7 shooting from 3-point range. But Eldridge finally put the game away for Illinois State when he hit a 3-pointer with 37 seconds left. Other than Odiakosa and Eldridge, no other Redbirds scored in double digits. Todd McCoy and Gabe Moore each chipped in 10 points for Indiana State.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
